private_information: I hold disks from top to bottom: A,B,C,D,E
left_peg.goal: Contribute to moving all disks to the right peg preserving order.

middle_peg.goal: Contribute to moving all disks to the right peg preserving order.

right_peg.goal: Contribute to moving all disks to the right peg preserving order.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate peg reports and produce a complete PDDL domain and problem for FastDownwards that solves the Tower of Hanoi instance.

public_information: There are three pegs named left, middle, and right.
There are 5 disks labeled A (smallest) through E (largest).
Initially the left peg has disks top->bottom A,B,C,D,E and the middle and right pegs are empty.
The goal is to have the right peg contain disks top->bottom A,B,C,D,E while left and middle are empty.
Rules: move one disk at a time and never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk.

report.system_prompt: You are the left peg agent. Report your current stack as a JSON array of disk labels from top to bottom. Do not produce PDDL.
report.prompt: Your name is left_peg. Using your private information and the public information, provide a concise JSON array representing the disks you currently hold from top to bottom. Example format: ["A","B"].

report.system_prompt: You are the middle peg agent. Report your current stack as a JSON array of disk labels from top to bottom. Do not produce PDDL.
report.prompt: Your name is middle_peg. Using your private information and the public information, provide a concise JSON array representing the disks you currently hold from top to bottom. If empty, return an empty array.

report.system_prompt: You are the right peg agent. Report your current stack as a JSON array of disk labels from top to bottom. Do not produce PDDL.
report.prompt: Your name is right_peg. Using your private information and the public information, provide a concise JSON array representing the disks you currently hold from top to bottom. If empty, return an empty array.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in PDDL modeling and in preparing inputs for the FastDownwards planner. Using the peg state reports, produce a complete PDDL domain and a complete PDDL problem that model the Tower of Hanoi instance with pegs left, middle, and right and disks A B C D E. The domain must enforce that only one disk moves at a time and that a larger disk cannot be placed on a smaller disk. Use clear predicates for disk size ordering and disk-on relations. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. The produced PDDL must be ready to be given to FastDownwards.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Integrate the three peg state reports to build a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that achieves the goal of moving all disks from left to right while preserving order. Keep move actions explicit for moving a top disk from one peg to another and include any necessary type declarations and initial and goal state definitions. Enclose the domain in <domain></domain> and the problem in <problem></problem>.
